revised_title: The Chemical Composition of Sea Water and Its Variations in Different Depths and Latitudes
tldr: The author investigates the chemical composition of sea water at different depths and latitudes, finding that the proportions of various elements remain relatively constant in the open ocean. The study also reveals that equatorial regions contain a higher percentage of saline matter due to evaporation and that the North Atlantic Ocean has more salt than the South Atlantic, likely due to the influence of the Gulf Stream.
